meanings.definition: To have eaten something in an unsatisfactory or improper manner.
meanings.sent1: She miseaten her sandwich, leaving behind a messy trail of crumbs.
meanings.sent2: The picky eater miseaten the vegetables, pushing them around the plate.
meanings.sent3: He miseaten the cake, trying to hide the parts he didn't like under the frosting.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel miseaten the nuts, discarding the ones that were not to its liking.
meanings.sent5: The child miseaten the candy, leaving a sticky mess on the table.

meanings.definition: Past participle of the verb 'miseat', meaning to eat something in an unsatisfactory or improper manner.
meanings.sent1: The cookies were miseaten by the dog when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The stale bread was miseaten by mistake, causing a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent3: The picnic food was miseaten by ants, creating a tiny feast for them.
meanings.sent4: The fruit was miseaten by time, turning brown and mushy.
meanings.sent5: The leftovers were miseaten by the cat, who found them irresistible.
